faction_profile.name: 공동파 (Kongtong Sect / 崆峒派)

location.significance: Legend says the Yellow Emperor visited the hermit Guangchengzi here. Often depicted as the 'Last Bastion' protecting the Central Plains from Western threats.

status.ranking: One of the Nine Great Sects. Considered one of the major Sword Sects alongside Wudang, Emei, and Mt. Hua.

faction_profile.core_theme: Bok-ma (伏魔) - Subduing Demons. Many arts are named 'Demon Subduing'.

combat_style.summary: Aggressive Taoist arts designed to destroy Evil (Ma).
combat_style.risk_factor: Some arts (like Seven Injuries Fist) harm the user to inflict maximum damage.

narrative_hook: Unlike the 'Soft' Taoism of Wudang, Kongtong represents the 'Hard/Punishing' side.
Possesses techniques that border on Unorthodox due to their destructive nature (e.g., Seven Injuries Fist).

signature_ultimate.name: 칠상권 (Seven Injuries Fist / 七傷拳)
signature_ultimate.description: A legendary fist art. It inflicts internal injuries on the user (damaging 7 organs) to unleash devastating power.
signature_ultimate.type: High Risk, High Return / Forbidden Art
signature_ultimate.narrative_use: Used by a desperate master or a tragic hero who sacrifices health for power.

list.name: 복마검 (Demon Subduing Sword)
list.description: Most common signature sword art. Designed to counter dark arts.

list: 칠살검 (Seven Kill Sword) - Aggressive name for a righteous sect.
현명신장 (Black Underworld God Palm) - Sometimes depicted as a dark/poisonous art.
천뢰복마신공 (Heavenly Thunder Demon Subduing Divine Art)

claw_and_finger.note: Unusually employs Claw arts for an Orthodox sect.
list: 삼음오공조 (Three Yin Centipede Claw) - Sounds villainous, reflecting their harsh nature.

suicidal_move.name: 인귀동도 (Man and Ghost Same Path / 人鬼동도)
suicidal_move.effect: Throwing one's body to perish together with the enemy (Dong-gwi-eo-jin). Similar to Kunlun's 'Jade Fragmentation'.
suicidal_move.usage: Last resort against a stronger demon/enemy.

narrative_role: The sect that holds the 'Seven Injuries Fist' scroll (a coveted item).
Guardians of the Western border (Gansu) alongside Kunlun.
A faction that is righteous but uses brutal methods (Claws, Self-harming fists) to fight evil.
Often portrayed as having internal conflict due to the dangers of their own martial arts.
